means: 使恼怒，激怒，恶化(exasperate的过去式)

sentence.Network_en: The president was clearly exasperated by the whole saga.
sentence.Network_cn: 整个事件显然让总统很恼火。

sentence.Network_en: Welland gave an exasperated sigh and turned back.
sentence.Network_cn: 韦兰十分烦恼地叹了口气，转过身去。

sentence.Network_en: Bertha was exasperated at the delay.

list.abs: To rouse to exasperation or anger ; provoke ., 使恼火 ; 激怒激起愤怒或恼怒 ; 煽动.
It showed the trend with the exasperate terms of trade of the developing country ., 它说明了发展中国家的贸易条件恶化的趋势.
This is an exasperating problem ., 这是一个棘手的难题.

because this is when arrangement ward , if arrive carelessly the mood of this kind of patient , can make an illness exasperate instead , the time of defer heal .因此在安排病房时，假如不注重到这种病人的心情，反而会使病情恶化，延迟痊愈的时间。

entry.def: If you describe a person as exasperated, you mean that they are frustrated or angry because of something that is happening or something that another person is doing.

example.ex: Bertha was exasperated at the delay...
The president was clearly exasperated by the whole saga...
example.tran: 整个事件显然让总统很恼火。

sentences.sentence: "had an exasperated look on his face"
